alert.note: Alert for Lipscomb; Ochiltree (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 03 at 8:36AM CDT until June 04 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Wolf Creek at Lipscomb affecting Ochiltree and Lipscomb Counties. For the Wolf Creek...including Lipscomb...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wolf Creek at Lipscomb. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Glen Turner Memorial Park at Lipscomb will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM CDT Saturday was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 6.5 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 03/29/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.
